skillTree.localised_description: The most impressive Nightmares are those reared on fresh blood. Such noble monstrosities are worthy mounts.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

skillTree.localised_description: Hellsteeds are vicious. Vampires that dabble in the binding of beasts delight in breaking these wild creatures to their will.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fly.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

skillTree.localised_description: These coaches serve as a way of transporting a Vampire anywhere he wishes, plowing through any opposition that would dare to stand in her way.

attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

skillTree.localised_description: "Who's queen? That's right… Now, prostrate yourself before me, worm!"

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 for all Peasant units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These deceptive creatures look so inoffensive and vulnerable that the enemy lowers his own defence, which is when they strike…

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

skillTree.localised_description: This Prophetess has a natural mastery over the Winds of Magic, which allows her to cloak and dissipate the Aethyric distortions around her.
Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
"See my coat of crimson armour? It is strengthened by thine blood and fear."
"Look into mine eyes, mortal; what glories do you see?"
The sword-strikes of mortal man are but clumsy, childish lunges before the preternatural speed of a Vampire.
The body of a Vampire looks human, but is capable of reactions so fast that even the quickest swordsman would look clumsy in comparison.
Strike hard, strike true.
The strength of this Vampire to endure the centuries is beyond compare.
To look upon this Undead Lord is to witness true and absolute horror!

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
A Vampire's eyes are like deep pits within which mortals find their doom; the unfortunate victims can do nothing but stare, entranced by the deadly hunter preparing to strike.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Harmonic Convergence"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Harmonic Convergence Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Harmonic Convergence Upgraded"

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Chain Lightning"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Be it a living peasant or an undead zombie, they shall learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.

skillTree.localised_description: The Lord howls out into the night, and is answered by the baying of dark creatures.

skillTree.localised_description: The Fallen Knight has followed the warrior's path to its ultimate conclusion, in a dark mockery of a Knight's vow.

skillTree.localised_description: Although nothing can replace the thrill of the charge and the righteous clash of steel, seriously heavy artillery generally helps.

skillTree.localised_description: For years these peasants have been called stupid, dull and sometimes with even worse names, that will stop now.

Armour: +12 for melee infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for melee infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for melee infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There are literally no opponents too great for them to face down. None.

skillTree.localised_description: "Can you hear it… the call of the night? Time for its children to arise and swarm."

skillTree.localised_description: The veteran marksman knows the precise range required to land the killing shot.

Passive ability: "Aura of Dark Majesty"
	(replaces: "Aura of Majesty")

skillTree.localised_description: A Lord of Necromancy's minions do not suffer exhaustion, they can walk for leagues and never suffer.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
A powerful, vigorous Lord of Darkness will see the Children of the Night gather unto them.

effects.description:
Character experience gain: +10%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A simple glamour can disguise a monstrous Vampire or Liche, so they may then charm and beguile the local populace.
Such a beast is all but impossible to destroy - an immortal horror doomed to haunt eternity!

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
This Lord has endless forbearance, a timeless patience crafted over millennia.

effects.description:
Attrition: -5% when under siege
	(armies in local owned region)

Attrition: -10% when under siege
	(armies in local owned region)

Attrition: -15% when under siege
	(armies in local owned region)

skillTree.localised_description: This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +8%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord can hear the thoughts of mortals for leagues around, and plan accordingly.

	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: To cause another's suffering, to delight in their pain, to extend their agony according to your whim. That is power.

effects.description:
The Dead Rise Again: +10% hit points for destroyed units restored after battle
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Evil-minded, poisonous malignancy. For its own sake.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -4
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Behind every thought they have - and every deed - is shameless, full-blooded spite.
"Some folk call me vicious. I'll scoop out the eyes of any who utter it in my presence."

effects.description:
Enemy casualty replenishment rate: -10%
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The scent of blood is enough to drive you into a mad frenzy.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Is it possible to dart aside and avoid a cannon ball? Is it possible to grab an arrow in fight with one's hand? It certainly is for these Vampires. The sword-strikes of even the most skilful men are but clumsy and childlike before the preternatural speed of the Vampire.
Your indiscretions about feeding have infected you with a horrid contagion, most commonly Scurvy Madness.
The Vampire enters the melee as he has always done in centuries past with a savage and unstoppable bloodlust. He won't stop until all his enemies lie dead on the ground.
Unbending even in the face of the greatest beasts, this Knight mounts their heads on the wall of his feasting chamber.
Driven by bloodlust beyond mortal comparison, the Vampire fights with an intensity that turns aside the most skilled parry or stoutest shield.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against anything and everything

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A master indeed - to rival the Great Necromancer himself?

effects.description:
Miscast base chance: -10% for all spellcasters
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Glory in your dark majesty, my lord."
Once forbidden knowledge is acquired, Necromancers and Vampires will jealously guard it from rivals' eyes.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(own army)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8
